DataSilos

Welcome to DataSilos.

The DataSilos application helps to separate data between different organisational units - so called "data silos".

In contrast to domain separation DataSilos is intended to allow the exchange of data (in form of individual records) between data silos on a need-to-know-basis.

Use DataSilos if

  • Domain Separation is too strict
  • Domain Separation is already implemented for a different purpose or if data silos should exist even within separated domains
  • there is a certain level of collaboration taking place between data silos
  • visibility of individual records can be defined by a user's assignment to groups

Do NOT use DataSilos if

  • the different data silos shall NEVER exchange any records (in that case Domain Separation may be considered)

Supported processes

  1. Incident

Installation guide

  1. Install the DataSilos application. If you see this installation guide within the ServiceNow instance, you did this already.
  2. Assign the x_snc_datasilos.datasilos_manager role to users.
  3. As a data silos manager go to the "Data Silos" module and configure all data silos. Add the corresponding groups to each data silo. Groups associated to a data silo are either "Fulfiller" groups or "Supervisor" groups. Supervisor groups see all records that were ever assigned to any group of a silo. Fulfiller groups only see those records that are created within the silo or that were explicitly assigned to them at least once.
  4. Prepare support for incidents:
    1. Switch to the GLOBAL scope.
    2. Add a new business rule for the 'incident' table.
    3. Configure the business rule as follows:
      4. Name: DataSilos - Incident
When: before
Insert: true
Update: true
Query: true
    4. Add the following script:
      5. (function executeRule(current, previous /*null when async*/) {

	x_snc_datasilos.ExecuteRule('incident',current, previous);
	
})(current, previous);
    5. Go to the "Business Rules" module and verify the new business rule is active and in the global scope.
    6. Verify you are still in GLOBAL scope
    7. Add a new business rule for the 'incident_task' table.
    8. Configure the business rule as follows:
      9. Name: DataSilos - Incident Task
When: before
Insert: true
Update: true
Query: true
    9. Add the following script:
      10. (function executeRule(current, previous /*null when async*/) {

	x_snc_datasilos.ExecuteRule('incident_task',current, previous);
	
})(current, previous);
    10. Go to the "Business Rules" module and verify the new business rule is active and in the global scope.
  5. Go to the "Options" module and activate the DataSilos application in general.
  6. Go to "Test Suite" and execute all tests.

FAQ

What happens if a user is not associated to any group?

The user will not see any records unless the user has the admin role.

What happens if a record is not associated to any group?

No user - except admins - will see this record.

How does it work?

DataSilos adds a new field to all relevant tables that contains a whitelist of groups. A user that is at least member of one of these whitelisted groups may see the record. Business rules in the global scope will alter the query and act on inserts and updates to control visibility and extend the whitelist where appropriate.

Developer guide

When extending the scope of the DataSilos application the following steps should be considered:

  1. Identify the affected tables
  2. Add the whitelist field to all affected tables:
    3. Type: List
Column label: DataSilos Group Whitelist
Column name: x_snc_datasilos_group_whitelist
Reference: Group
Reference cascade rule: None (not "--None--"!)
  3. Add create, write and delete Access Controls to the table columns for all affected tables:
    4. Requires role: x_snc_datasilos.datasilos_manager
  4. Extend the ExecuteRule script include to support the extended tables
  5. Add corresponding business rules
  6. Create an ATF test
  7. Update THIS documentation
